subject: Programming
title: Consistent Formatting
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Consistent Formatting.

hook.text: Tabs versus spaces sparked wars, but the real enemy is inconsistency.

buildup.text: Consistent formatting lets readers scan code without re-adjusting their mental model.

discovery.text: Teams that agree on one style and automate it spend zero time arguing about formatting.

twist.text: It doesn't matter which style you pick. It matters that everyone uses the same one.

climax.text: Prettier, Black, and gofmt ended the debate. Let the tool decide and move on to real problems.

punchline.text: Pick a style. Automate it. Never debate again.

quiz.question: What is the best way to handle code formatting in a team?
options: Agree on one style and automate it
Let each person use their own style
Use no formatting rules at all
